title: Flat band excitons and quantum metric
authors: Xuzhe Ying and K. T. Law
abstract:
We discuss the excitons in flat band systems. Quantum metric plays a central
role in determining the properties of single exciton excitation as well as the
exciton condensate. While the electrons and holes are extremely heavy in flat
bands, the excitons (boundstate of an electron-hole pair) could be light and
mobile. In particular, we show that the inverse of exciton's effective mass
tensor is proportional to the quantum metric tensor. Meanwhile, the flat band
excitons have a finite size, lower bounded by the trace of the quantum metric
tensor. Given the properties of single exciton excitation, one can argue for
the formation of exciton condensate. Because of the quantum metric, the exciton
condensate can support dissipationless counterflow supercurrent, implying the
stability of exciton condensate.
